Package com.jenmann.controller

Class UserAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jenmann.controller.UserAPI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertiesLoader
    @Path("/users")
public class UserAPI
extends java.lang.Object
implements PropertiesLoader
    This endpoint is responsible for handling all data related to users for DMBook. I chose to include the data related to the user's encounters and characters here in this slightly long class on purpose to centralize that processing around the JWTs. Additionally, I was curious about the ability to create an admin interface that would handle all users' data through the decentralized/resource-specific APIs.
    Author:
    jcmann

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserAPI

        public UserAPI()

    • Method Detail

      • userFetcher

        public User userFetcher​(java.lang.String jwt)
        This helper method is called by each endpoint to reduce code duplication in getting the user. If the user is validated in AWS but not found, it calls a helper method to update the database to include the user, effectively synchronizing AWS/the database.
        Parameters:
        jwt - The JWT received by the endpoint, an ID token
        Returns:
        null if the user was not found, or a user object if a user was found

      • createNewUser

        public User createNewUser​(java.lang.String username)
        If a user exists in AWS, but not in the database, the user should be created, which is done in this method.
        Parameters:
        username - the username, processed out of the original jwt, of the user to create
        Returns:
        the User object created

      • getAllUserData

        @GET
@Path("{jwt}/all")
@Produces("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAllUserData​(@PathParam("jwt")
                                                java.lang.String jwt)
        This endpoint is sort of tailor-made for my React frontend, which initializes all data belonging to a user when the app is first opened. Async JS makes it tricky to request several endpoints' worth of data in one handler method, so I wrote an endpoint to return all the necessary data in one go.
        Parameters:
        jwt - a JWT representing the AWS Amplify/Cognito ID Token
        Returns:
        If successful, a 200 and a JSON object containing all the user's characters and encounters, as well as all monsters. Otherwise, 404s represent failures at this endpoint.

      • getUserEncounters

        @GET
@Path("{jwt}/encounters")
@Produces("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getUserEncounters​(@PathParam("jwt")
                                                   java.lang.String jwt)
        This endpoint expects a user ID, and will return the encounters associated with that user ID.
        Parameters:
        jwt - a JWT from the client of a user
        Returns:
        A 200 response with stringified JSON representing all encounters found, or a 404 if any step fails.

      • addNewEncounter

        @POST
@Path("{jwt}/encounters")
@Consumes("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addNewEncounter​(@PathParam("jwt")
                                                 java.lang.String jwt,
                                                 java.lang.String body)
        This endpoint handles post requests that seek to add a new character belonging to a given user. It expects the body to be sent as a JSON String, which is then parsed here.
        Parameters:
        jwt - the ID Token JWT for the currently logged in user
        body - a JSON String containing all form data for the new character (except user id)
        Returns:
        a 200 response if post was successful, 404 if it failed at any point

      • editEncounter

        @PUT
@Path("{jwt}/encounters/{idToUpdate}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response editEncounter​(@PathParam("jwt")
                                               java.lang.String jwt,
                                               @PathParam("idToUpdate")
                                               int idToUpdate,
                                               java.lang.String body)
        This endpoint handles all PUT requests for a user's encounter.
        Parameters:
        jwt - An AWS Amplify/Cognito ID Token for a currently logged in user
        idToUpdate - The ID of the encounter to perform the update on
        body - Request body should contain all data for the encounter
        Returns:
        An int, 1, if update was successful, or a 404 if it failed at any step

      • deleteEncounterByID

        @DELETE
@Path("{jwt}/encounters/{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteEncounterByID​(@PathParam("jwt")
                                                     java.lang.String jwt,
                                                     @PathParam("id")
                                                     int idToDelete)
        This endpoint handles all requests to delete a user's given encounter given an ID. Sources: - https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12695268/verify-create-update-delete-successfully-executed-in-hibernate
        Parameters:
        jwt - An AWS Cognito/Amplify ID Token for a currently signed in user
        idToDelete - An ID of an encounter belonging to the user matching the JWT
        Returns:
        a 200 if successfully deleted, a 404 if not

      • getUserCharacters

        @GET
@Path("{jwt}/characters")
@Produces("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getUserCharacters​(@PathParam("jwt")
                                                   java.lang.String jwt)
        This endpoint expects a user ID token as a JWT, and will return the characters associated with that user.
        Parameters:
        jwt - the ID token for a logged in user
        Returns:
        A 200 response with stringified JSON representing all characters found belonging to the user, or a 404

      • addNewCharacter

        @POST
@Path("{jwt}/characters")
@Consumes("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addNewCharacter​(@PathParam("jwt")
                                                 java.lang.String jwt,
                                                 java.lang.String body)
        This endpoint handles post requests that seek to add a new character belonging to a given user. It expects the body to be sent as a JSON String, which is then parsed here.
        Parameters:
        jwt - the ID Token JWT for the currently logged in user
        body - a JSON String containing all form data for the new character (except user id)
        Returns:
        A 200 if successfully added, or a 404 if not

      • editCharacter

        @PUT
@Path("{jwt}/characters/{idToUpdate}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response editCharacter​(@PathParam("jwt")
                                               java.lang.String jwt,
                                               @PathParam("idToUpdate")
                                               int idToUpdate,
                                               java.lang.String body)
        This endpoint handles all PUT requests to update a user's character, specified by ID.
        Parameters:
        jwt - jwt the ID Token JWT for the currently logged in user
        idToUpdate - The ID for the Character to be updated
        body - Stringified JSON representing all data about the character to be updated
        Returns:
        a 200 if the update was successful, otherwise a 404

      • deleteCharacterByID

        @DELETE
@Path("{jwt}/characters/{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteCharacterByID​(@PathParam("jwt")
                                                     java.lang.String jwt,
                                                     @PathParam("id")
                                                     int idToDelete)
        This endpoint is responsible for deleting a given character by ID that belongs to a given user.
        Parameters:
        jwt - the ID Token JWT for the currently logged in user
        idToDelete - the ID of the character to delete
        Returns:
        a 200 response if the delete was successful, or a 404

      • processJWT

        public java.lang.String processJWT​(java.lang.String jwt)
        This is a helper method used for all Users API endpoints. A JWT that contains a valid, logged-in user must be passed as the first parameter to access any DMBook data. Each endpoint must, then, validate the JWT provided from the client before providing any data.
        Parameters:
        jwt - The JWT, passed from the endpoint, to validate
        Returns:
        username of the validated user, or null if no validated user was found
